newsitem.title: SLOVAKIA: Slovak SAX index slips on losses to Nafta shares.
newsitem.headline: Slovak SAX index slips on losses to Nafta shares.

text.p: The Slovak SAX index eased slightly in moderate trading on the Bratislava Stock Exchange on Thursday, pushed down by losses to shares of oil and gas storage company Nafta NAFT.BV.
Nafta fell 60 crowns to 1,600, with its average price -- used for calculating the index -- slipping 4.4 percent as the SAX eased 0.86 points to 204.87.

Brokers said they expected Nafta's share price to fall further. "The firm has a majority owner, which, combined with its bad image among investors, supports our expectation of a further price decline," Dusan Sykora of ING Barings said.
Steel maker VSZ was most active among listed issues with 3,060 shares changing hands, closing unchanged at 745 crowns.
Oil refiner Slovnaft closed down five crowns at 995, with brokers not expecting any significant moves with its price amid expectations over the company's dividend policy.
Overall volume fell to 181.416 shares, from 527,757 stocks traded on Wednesday, while turnover decreased to 70.52 million crowns from 340.74 million.
